Numerous studies have linked exposure to RF radiation from cell towers to increased rates of cancer, particularly brain tumors and acoustic neuromas. The International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) has classified RF radiation as "possibly carcinogenic to humans" based on this evidence. In addition to cancer risks, research suggests 5G radiation can cause oxidative stress, DNA damage, and inflammation in the body. These biological impacts have been linked to a host of health problems including headaches, fatigue, skin rashes, cognitive impairment, and damage to the eyes and testes. The pulsed nature of 5G signals may also interfere with normal cellular functions and disrupt the blood-brain barrier.

Doctors and scientists worldwide are sounding the alarm about the premature rollout of 5G without adequate safety testing. The potential health consequences are simply too severe to ignore.
